casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff—Appellee, v. Russell Lee EBERSOLE, Defendant-Appellant. No. 07-7668. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Feb. 28, 2008. Decided: March 10, 2008. Russell Lee Ebersole, Appellant Pro Se.

Before WILKINSON, NIEMEYER, and MICHAEL, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Russell Lee Ebersole appeals the district court’s order denying relief on his motion for relief from his criminal judgment. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. United States v. Ebersole, No. 1:03-cr-00112-LMB (E.D.Va. Oct. 23, 2007). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
